casebody.data:
*EDWARD MILLINER v. ANNA MILLINER. Divorce — kink—wilful absence — confinement to one man. These parties were voluntarily married; but it was in evidence,-, that at the in-fare following the wedding, “ she took a kink,” and *139threatened to leave; but the father of the groom persuaded her to go with her husband. She did do so, and staid only a few days, and left him saying, she would not be confined to one man, and has never returned for more than three years. Divorce decreed.

Where a wife who leaves her husband shortly after marriage, declaring she will not be confined to one man, and continues absent for three years, it is cause for divorce.

Divorce. Cause — three years’ wilful absence.
